name: Jump Rope
instructions: Jump with both feet together using a steady rhythm.
Maintain upright posture and light knees.
Use intervals for conditioning.
tips: Start with short intervals and increase duration gradually.

name: Interval Sprints
instructions: Perform short maximal sprints followed by recovery intervals.
Repeat for set rounds (e.g., 10 × 30s on / 90s off).
Warm up thoroughly beforehand.
tips: Keep sprint form tight to reduce injury risk.
ratingDesc: One of the most time-efficient cardio methods.

name: Rowing (Machine)
instructions: Drive with legs, hinge at hips, then pull with arms on recovery.
Maintain smooth rhythm and full strokes.
Use steady pace or intervals as needed.
tips: Focus on leg drive rather than pulling with arms.

name: Stair Climber
instructions: Climb at steady pace or perform intervals for intensity.
Use posture and step fully with heel drive.
Keep moderate hand usage for balance only.
tips: Long climbs build endurance; intervals build power.

name: Cycling (Indoor)
instructions: Maintain cadence and resistance for target zones.
Use intervals or steady-state depending on goals.
Keep posture neutral and core engaged.
tips: Use music or classes to maintain motivation and tempo.
ratingDesc: Low-impact endurance builder with high calorie burn.

name: Rowing Intervals
instructions: Perform short high-power rows followed by recovery.
Focus on stroke power and core stability.
Repeat for 8–12 rounds.
tips: Monitor wattage or split times for consistency.

name: Bear Crawls
instructions: Crawl forward on hands and feet keeping hips low.
Move with controlled, quick steps for distance or time.
Keep head neutral and core braced.
tips: Great for short metabolic conditioning and mobility.

name: High Knees
instructions: Run on the spot bringing knees high toward chest.
Maintain quick cadence and breathe constantly.
Use for warm-ups or short intervals.
tips: Keep posture upright and land softly on midfoot.
